sub_topic: Probability of a certain outcome in a sports game
message_1: A basketball player has a success rate of 80% in free-throw shots. What is the probability that they will make exactly 3 out of 4 free-throw shots?
message_2:
To calculate the probability of the basketball player making exactly 3 out of 4 free-throw shots, we can use the binomial probability formula:

P(X = k) = C(n, k) * p^k * (1-p)^(n-k)

where:
- P(X = k) is the probability of making exactly k successful shots
- C(n, k) is the number of combinations of n items taken k at a time (n choose k)
- n is the total number of shots (in this case, 4)
- k is the number of successful shots (in this case, 3)
- p is the success rate (in this case, 80% or 0.8)
- (1-p) is the failure rate (in this case, 20% or 0.2)

First, we calculate C(4, 3):

C(4, 3) = 4! / (3! * (4-3)!)
C(4, 3) = 4! / (3! * 1!)
C(4, 3) = (4 * 3 * 2 * 1) / (3 * 2 * 1 * 1)
C(4, 3) = 4

Now, we can plug the values into the binomial probability formula:

P(X = 3) = C(4, 3) * p^3 * (1-p)^(4-3)
P(X = 3) = 4 * (0.8)^3 * (0.2)^(1)
P(X = 3) = 4 * (0.512) * (0.2)
P(X = 3) = 4 * 0.1024
P(X = 3) â‰ˆ 0.4096

So, the probability that the basketball player will make exactly 3 out of 4 free-throw shots is approximately 40.96%.
